head.title: Home - Ballico Cressey School District

input.name: __VIEWSTATE

a.title: Go to Ballico Cressey School District

div.style: position: absolute; left: 0px; top: 0px; z-index: 100001; background-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); opacity: 0.5; display: none;

a.title: Ballico Cressey Broadcast Club Application Form
a.span: Ballico Cressey Broadcast Club Application Form

li.a: Ballico Cressey Broadcast Club Application Form

h2.style: font-size: 25px; letter-spacing: 2px; margin: 0px; padding: 3px 5px; background: rgb(0, 0, 205); border-top: 2px solid rgb(0, 0, 231); border-bottom: 2px solid rgb(0, 0, 231); color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-align: center;

font-size: 25px; letter-spacing: 2px; margin: 0px; padding: 3px 5px; background: rgb(0, 0, 205); border-top: 2px solid rgb(0, 0, 231); border-bottom: 2px solid rgb(0, 0, 231); color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-align: center;

div.style: text-align: center;

h2.span: Spring Break is Monday, April 13th through Friday, April 17th. All facilities will be closed. There will be no instruction and no food service during the week of Spring Break. Distance learning and food service will resume Monday, April 20th through the end of the school year, or until circumstances / conditions change.

p.style: text-align: center;
text-align: center;

br.span: As a precautionary step to prevent the spread of COVID-19, and in consultation with Merced County school district leaders and health officials,

div.span: we are supporting a suspension of school operations in Merced County effective Thursday, March 19 through the endo of the school year unless ceared by the Dept of Health conditions for the county. By closing effective Thursday, this gives our families time to make arrangements for child care. We plan to use "distance learning for the rerst of the school year unless otherwise permitted.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: Arial, sans-serif; border-style: none; border-width: initial;
p.span: This is not a decision we take lightly. We know that temporarily closing a school has a tremendous impact on our families. The safety of our students and staff remains our top priority, and we have confidence that this is the proper precautionary course for Merced County. We are working with all of our local education agencies to support the continuity of learning and to ensure students have access to healthy meals.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: Arial, sans-serif;
p.span: Public health officials recommend that families make arrangements for child care during closure that avoids leaving children with elderly or those with compromised immune systems who are more vulnerable to the impact of the virus.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: Arial, sans-serif;
p.span: This is a dynamic situation where information and circumstances can evolve quickly. For the latest updates, visit the California Public Health Department’s 2019 novel coronavirus website at: https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/Immunization/ncov2019 and for local health updates visit the Merced County Health Department’s 2019 novel coronavirus website at: https://countyofmerced.com/coronavirus.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: Arial, sans-serif;
p.span: We also understand that implementing these changes with such limited notice is challenging and disruptive, and we appreciate your patience and cooperation. We are grateful to community members throughout Merced County for their tremendous prevention efforts during these challenging times.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: Arial, sans-serif;

strong.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 255); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;

p.style: text-align: left;

div.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); width: 1208px; padding: 0px 0px 20px; font-size: medium; font-family: Roboto, RobotoDraft, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;
padding: 0px; font-size: 0.875rem;
font-size: small; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-stretch: normal;
background: rgb(242, 242, 242); width: auto; padding: 0px;
border-width: 0px; position: absolute; overflow: hidden; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; left: 285px; top: 16px; width: 1px; height: 1px;
margin: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 20px; width: 1208px; color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Roboto, RobotoDraft, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: medium;
font-size: 0.875rem; direction: ltr; margin: 8px 0px 0px; padding: 0px; position: relative;
overflow: hidden; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: small; line-height: 1.5; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;

p.style: margin: 0px; line-height: normal; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;
p.span: As a precautionary step to prevent the spread of COVID-19, and in consultation with Merced County school district leaders and health officials,

we are supporting a suspension of school operations in Merced County effective Thursday, March 19 through Friday, April 17. By closing effective Thursday, this gives our families time to make arrangements for child care. We plan to reopen on April 20, but that decision will depend on the circumstances at the time.

p.style: margin: 0px; line-height: normal; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;

p.style: margin: 0px; line-height: normal; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; border-width: initial; border-style: none;
p.span: This is not a decision we take lightly. We know that temporarily closing a school has a tremendous impact on our families. The safety of our students and staff remains our top priority, and we have confidence that this is the proper precautionary course for Merced County. We are working with all of our local education agencies to support the continuity of learning and to ensure students have access to healthy meals.

p.span: We also understand that implementing these changes with such limited notice is challenging and disruptive, and we appreciate your patience and cooperation. We are grateful to community members throughout Merced County for their tremendous prevention efforts during these challenging times.

div.style: border-bottom-left-radius: 1px; border-bottom-right-radius: 1px; padding: 0px; width: auto; background: rgb(242, 242, 242); margin: 0px;
border-width: 0px; position: absolute; overflow: hidden; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; left: 3px; top: 16px; width: 1px; height: 1px;

p.style: margin: 0px; line-height: normal; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;
p.span: As a precautionary step to prevent the spread of COVID-19, and in consultation with Merced County school district leaders and health officials,

we are supporting a suspension of school operations in Merced County effective Thursday, March 19 through Friday, April 17. By closing effective Thursday, this gives our families time to make arrangements for child care. We plan to reopen on April 20, but that decision will depend on the circumstances at the time.

p.style: margin: 0px; line-height: normal; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

p.style: margin: 0px; line-height: normal; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; border-width: initial; border-style: none;
p.span: This is not a decision we take lightly. We know that temporarily closing a school has a tremendous impact on our families. The safety of our students and staff remains our top priority, and we have confidence that this is the proper precautionary course for Merced County. We are working with all of our local education agencies to support the continuity of learning and to ensure students have access to healthy meals.

p.style: margin: 0px; line-height: normal; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; border-width: initial; border-style: none;

margin: 0px; line-height: normal; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;
p.span: Public health officials recommend that families make arrangements for child care during closure that avoids leaving children with elderly or those with compromised immune systems who are more vulnerable to the impact of the virus.

p.style: margin: 0px; line-height: normal; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;

h2.span:
Welcome to Ballico Cressey
School District

p.style: text-align: center;
p.span:
Parents- Please help us by participating in our
LCAP Survey and help us to prioritize
our goals for the coming school years
LCAP SURVEY LINK

The Ballico Cressey School District resides in Merced County along the Merced River. The district houses two school sites: Cressey Elementary and Ballico Elementary. We are a 1:1 school district with each student having their own digital device. The district also offers free internet to all families who do not have internet access at home with Verizon HotSpots. Learning in and out of school is an important aspect of the district's educational philosophy where KIDS COME FIRST. The district is committed to providing high-quality education to a diverse student body. We are achieving goals through a challenging curriculum, quality teachers, and an atmosphere that emphasizes communication and cooperation. Together, these elements create a safe and engaging learning environment in which all students excel.
